alert.note: Alert for Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 4:55PM EDT until August 10 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky, south central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Estill. In south central Kentucky, Rockcastle. In southeast Kentucky, Jackson. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clover Bottom, Threelinks, Morrill, Eglon, Kerby Knob, Shirley, Goochland, Climax, Sandgap, Johnetta, Disputanta, Hisel, Bummer, Brazil, Locust Branch, Alcorn, Wildie and Hummel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
